meanings.definition: A primitive excretory organ in some invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The pronephra helps certain bugs get rid of waste.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the pronephra in simple animals to learn more about their excretory systems.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pronephra in the worm works hard to keep it clean and healthy.
meanings.sent4: The pronephra of the jellyfish is like a tiny cleaning crew inside its body.
meanings.sent5: In the world of tiny creatures, the pronephra is the unsung hero of waste management.

meanings.definition: The anterior part of the embryonic kidney in vertebrates.
meanings.sent1: During development, the pronephra forms the early structure of the kidney in baby animals.
meanings.sent2: The pronephra plays a crucial role in the early stages of kidney development in vertebrates.
meanings.sent3: The pronephra in the baby bird's body is like a little kidney architect.
meanings.sent4: As the embryo grows, the pronephra transforms into the foundation of the kidney.
meanings.sent5: The pronephra is the first step in the amazing journey of kidney formation in animals.
